title: Legionellales
text:
The Legionellales are an order of <a href="Proteobacteria">Proteobacteria</a>. Like all Proteobacteria, they are <a href="Gram-negative">Gram-negative</a>. They comprise two families, typified by "<a href="Legionella">Legionella</a>" and "<a href="Coxiella%20burnetii">Coxiella</a>", both of which include notable pathogens. For example, <a href="Q%20fever">Q fever</a> is caused by "<a href="Coxiella%20burnetii">Coxiella burnetii</a>" and "<a href="Legionella%20pneumophila">Legionella pneumophila</a>" causes <a href="Legionellosis">Legionnaires' disease</a> and <a href="Pontiac%20fever">Pontiac fever</a>.
Members of the order "Legionellales" can be molecularly distinguished from other Gammaproteobacteria by the presence of four <a href="conserved%20signature%20indels">conserved signature indels</a> (CSIs) in the proteins tRNA-guanine(34) transglycosylase, lipoprotein-releasing system transmembrane protein lolE and tRNA (guanosine(37)-N1)-methyltransferase TrmD.
